metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45421 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight and Gabriele Svelto reported memorysafety bugs present in Thunderbird 102.4. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox< 107.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
